Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • Position
  • public class Position
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements the abstraction of each square on the checkerboard or pixels on the board view

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Position​(int x, int y)
      initialize x and y checking if they are inside the board view
      Position​(java.awt.Point point)
      constructor with Point (mainly for the mouse getPoint() method that returns a point)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int direction​(Position final_pos)
      Returns the cardinal direction of the vector this -> final_pos approximate to: up=2, right=1, down=0, left=3 there is no movement=-1 when the x or y distances is less than MIN_MOUSE_DRAG
      boolean equals​(Position pos)
      Checks if the current Position is the same as the one passed as argument
      Position pixelConverter()
      Converts the pos from the units of board to pixels
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the coordinates of the position to a String
      Position unitConverter()
      Converts the pos from pixels to the units of board

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Position

        public Position​(int x,
                int y)
        initialize x and y checking if they are inside the board view
        Parameters:
        x - x value
        y - y value

      • Position

        public Position​(java.awt.Point point)
        constructor with Point (mainly for the mouse getPoint() method that returns a point)
        Parameters:
        point - Point that will be converted in Position

    • Method Detail

      • direction

        public int direction​(Position final_pos)
        Returns the cardinal direction of the vector this -> final_pos approximate to: up=2, right=1, down=0, left=3 there is no movement=-1 when the x or y distances is less than MIN_MOUSE_DRAG
        Parameters:
        final_pos - Position
        Returns:
        int of direction

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Position pos)
        Checks if the current Position is the same as the one passed as argument
        Parameters:
        pos - Position to compare
        Returns:
        true if the positions are the same

      • unitConverter

        public Position unitConverter()
        Converts the pos from pixels to the units of board
        Returns:
        Position in units

      • pixelConverter

        public Position pixelConverter()
        Converts the pos from the units of board to pixels
        Returns:
        Position in pixels

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the coordinates of the position to a String
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String of coordinates
